greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the fractional part of Sum_{n>=1} cos((n + 1)*Pi)*zeta(2*n) = zeta(2) - zeta(4) + zeta(6) - zeta(8) + ..., where Zeta is the Riemann zeta function.
comment: For odd upper bounds, the sum converges to the given value p in (0,1) with no fractional part function necessary. For even upper bounds, the sum converges to p+1.
Decimal expansion of (psi(i)-psi(-i))/2/i-3/2 where psi is the digamma function. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 28 2004
formula: Equals Pi*(coth(Pi))/2 -1 where Pi = A000796. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 01 2010
mathematica: RealDigits[Pi*Coth[Pi]/2 - 1, 10, 105] // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2014, after _R. J. Mathar_ *)
results.author: Joseph Biberstine (jrbibers(AT)indiana.edu), Nov 27 2004
